subject: Torch Relay Form
description:
From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>

Hi Danny,

Further to my email last week, we are going to need to create the
Torch Relay D&I form. It’s essentially a case of replicating the form
attached (I’m checking this is the latest), but I have provided full
requirements below.

I have a question about one of the requirements. I’ve stated that all
questions should be mandatory and that a message should be displayed
on attempted submission if any questions are missed out. I’m sure this
is doable, but would it be easier if all questions were optional?
(Want to keep this as simple as possible.)

I’d like to be able to test this from Monday as it has to be available
on Thursday. I appreciate this is late notice – could you let me know
if this is doable, and what additional info you need from me?

Thanks,

Andy

OTR D&I Requirement

·         A form is required to anonymously capture LOCOG’s standard
D&I information for all nominees being taken forward to the selection
phase of the TB process (see D&I form attached)

·         Nominees will be able to optionally submit their information
via the form using a link  that will appear in their nominee
acceptance email

·         The form should be hidden on the website (not in navigation
and not searchable)

·         The form should use a Captcha or similar to prevent spamming

·         Submissions should be via a secure HTTPS connection.

·         It must be possible to extract the data to CSV, XML or XLS format.

·         The form does not require validation as all questions will
be multi-choice only. All questions will be mandatory, with a prefer
not to say option. (Might be easier to make all questions optional –
would this be acceptable?)

·         An informative message must be displayed if a user tries to
submit their D&I form without completing all questions.

·         The form should be built within a standard OTR page
template. Designs for the TB detail form, which originally included
these fields, will be made available.

·         Space for instructional text is required at the top of the
form, below the page title.

·         A thank-you page is also required to which users will be
directed upon submitting the form. (This can be a standard OTR content
template.)

As agreed this morning, we will aim to get this done by Monday evening, but without captcha. We need to give you a cost estimate before we start work.

Hi Andy,

Form is here
http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/diversity-and-inclusion-form.php

You can view and download the data here
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/diversityregistrants

CSV export button at the top of the above url / interface (see attached)

You can edit the test at the top of the form but let me know if you want us to update the thank you message (or any other questions / queries / feedback)

Jamie

Hi Jamie,

Spotted a few issues, but I've just discovered that we have a survey tool at our disposal that we can use to collect the D&I data, so we won't need this now. Could you tie it off (unpublish the page I guess) and leave it.

Sorry to have unnecessarily added to your workload over the last couple of days!

Andy

subject: Learning Legacy micro site update @ 11/8
description:
NOT PROTECTIVELY MARKED Hi Jamie, Danny, I hope you're well. Further to our conversation last week, I was just wondering how things were progressing with the amends to the Learning Legacy micro site? Will we be able to have access this week? I know that we have been back and forth a lot with changes, so I thought it might be helpful to check that we're both on the same page and get an idea of current status/progress. Please could you update the table below with current status of the changes: Changes requested Progress/status Publication template/page Publication editor Taxonomies Publication list template/page Addition of sub themes Champion reports as web pages Video template/page* *I'm not sure that we've had costs for the addition of a video template/page, so would you be able to send through a revised quote? The next table is an update on a couple of other bits that we have spoken about, but not commissioned work on yet - there is just one query that I would be grateful if you could answer for me: Potential changes Update/actions MP3s Could you confirm if we need to make any changes to add in audio recordings to the website? subject: Test map page on staging
description:
With the issues we have been having with the Stamen map over the last year, we have engaged them to rebuild the map onto 2 new servers in our datacentre.

Next week - we anticipate being in a position to test the new server and would like Kitiste to build a one-off map page on staging that instead of the assets pointing to 

Map.london2012.com
data.Map.london2012.com
data.webcams.london2012.com
road.tiles.Map.london2012.com

Points to the Ip addresses of the 2 new boxes in our datacentre which will be supplied.

The idea is that it will replicate the new map in the existing page london2012.com/map.php without needing to make the DNS changes or setup temporary domains.

subject: Load balancer change 11th August - Kitsite staging
description:
The current load balancer does not balance load properly - it cannot determine if the webserver is serving pages or not.

We are making a planned change to have the load balancer check for a 200 from a 'safe' piece of content on each of the webservers - the content we are going to use is the Akamai sureroute page as this is not in the CMS or is it in the RSYNC job so will always be there.

We will test this new config out on the Kitsite staging servers on Thursday 11th August - the Load balancer will start looking for 

http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/DSA_SLA_test_page/akamai-sureroute-test-object.htm

but will need a restart of Stage03 and Stage04 to make the change happen.

If this works well then we will move this to Kitsite production Web01 - Web06

I am hoping that this will be OK with kitsite and that this will not interfere with your development that you are doing.

Thanks

Russ

description:
Hello 

Please be advised of the following email Proactive Alert we have just received. 

This has now been raised by ourselves as a Priority 3 Proactive Alert under BT Case Ref :- 264583

Please acknowledge this alert by return email, including your reference number if applicable. 

If you require any further assistance, please contact the BT Data Centre Services Helpdesk on 0800 731 1713 or via email to ah.support@bt.com

Regards,
BT Data Centre Services | 0800 731 1713 | ah.support@bt.com |

-----Original Message-----
From: Amit Kumar via IPim [mailto:BT-LOCOG-general@ipcenter.ipsoft.com] 
Sent: 30 June 2011 14:20
To: amit.kumar@ip-soft.net
Subject: [IPsoft #4963267] (BT-LOCOG-general) locog file system issues on pres03/web05 

Helpdesk,

Can you coordinate with the owners of the applications on these hosts.

The apache is configured to dump data in /  partition, it has risk of getting full, thus stopping the essential services including apache.

Please pass this to owners, and have a change ticket for this activity.



pres03

The Document Root is specified as /var/www/html, and all the images etc are dumped in this directory taking around 5 Gb of the space, and log file location is specified as  /var/log

This set up needs to change so that Document root goes in /apps/www and log files go in /apps/www/log, as it is not standard practice to have / specified for these.
There is a risk of getting / also filled up, in which case apache instance would crash and users would not be able to login.

This will take a maintenance window, where IPsoft can move the data in the directory /apps/www and "migurski" or someone from developer team can change the DocumentRoot
and logs location in apache config file [/etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf].



web05

log location in the apache config files is specified as /var/logs.

This has taken around 6gb on / (root) partition.

They should be specified as /apps/apache/logs.

IPsoft can move the log file, but locog team needs to change the location in the config file.

This would need a restart of apache, and around 10 minutes of downtime.

"IPsoft can move the log file, but locog team needs to change the location in the config file.". Marking as high.

Russ,

The logs no longer live in /apps/apache for a reason: /apps/apache is periodically synchronised from web01->2..6. Synchronising the log files across all servers is obviously pointless and destructive - as well as being time and bandwidth-consuming.

The synchronisation of web01-06 is outside of Kitsite's control but I would like to present the following two options for fixing this issue:

 1. Request that ipsoft amend the synchronisation process such that /apps/apache/logs is excluded from the synchronisation process. Kitsite would then amend the apache config across all 6 servers (plus the two staging servers) in order to write logs to the new location.

 2. Kitsite amend the servers web01-06 such that "/etc/httpd/logs" is symlinked to a new folder, named /apps/logs/apache (note that it's NOT in /apps/apache and is thus excluded from the synchronisation process). The logs will carry on being rotated - as at present - by linux's "logrotate" subsystem. No change to apache config (or downtime) necessary.

I can only provide an estimate for (2.) which would be up to one day (although hopefully closer to 1/2 day).

Kieran

Here is the response from IPsoft on this - 

It appears that Kitsite have changed the apache log location (3rd June) on all 6 london2012 web-servers but there are a few inconsistencies.
We’ve been escalating a problem we picked-up with AWstats because it broke but we haven’t had a response back about it yet (probably because there’s a lack of understanding and my engineers haven’t been making it clear)

The position we’re in as detailed below means the following:

•	The log location is not the same on all servers (exception is web06 which hasn’t been changed)
•	There is no log rotation on web05 (it has been removed)
•	The log location has been shifted to /var/log/httpd/ - the root file system.  It this fills up your web-server will crash (imminently for web05)

We need to do two things urgently to protect the web-server farm and get AWstats back up and running:

•	Move the logs back to /apps/logs/httpd/ (this will require a restart of apache on web01 – web05)
•	Reconfigure the log rotation for 4 weeks as previously agreed



I think we need to do a joint apporach here - which is essentially what I think both of you are saying.

I would like to get a call together for us to discuss and agree this and have a set course of action.

Russ

Russ, has anyone at IPsoft seen Kieran's previous response? Their description does not refer to it. It would be very helpful if before we have the conference call, whoever at IPsoft is on the call has had a chance to look at it and respond. Many thanks.
yes - you both have each others comments on this
We are now intending to do the update to httpd.com on Wed, pending instructions from IPsoft.
Can this be closed - we made this change and it has fixed the issue as can be seen from the Web05 root directory.

subject: French homepage
description:
For some reason the blog panel on the french homepage appears to have gone missing. I'm fairly sure it was working yesterday, so not sure what it is that might have changed since then.

It would be great if you could find time to look at this ASAP, as I'm a bit concerned about having a broken FR homepage during the torch announcements.

I'm seeing the same problem in IE, Firefox and Chrome.

comments.value:
For some reason the blog panel on the french homepage appears to have gone missing. I'm fairly sure it was working yesterday, so not sure what it is that might have changed since then.

It would be great if you could find time to look at this ASAP, as I'm a bit concerned about having a broken FR homepage during the torch announcements.

I'm seeing the same problem in IE, Firefox and Chrome.

Okay - just realised there never was a blog, and the gap is left because of the removal of the map. We should find something to fill this though.

Any ideas? Ideally something that doesn't need translations. How about a most recent Photos panel? 

The other alternative could be a static banner for the shop?
we could go with any of these. Tell us which one you want to go for and we will have a look at it, although some solutions may be more time-consuming than others.

Right - photos are a no go as they shouldn't be being translated (even though the landing page is)

Can we just do a box called 'Sites' that features a photo of a venue and links through to its venue page?

Is it possible to always load a random venue, or would it be better to make this editorially controlled?
I think the map is on it's way back very soon, which means the simplest solution will probably be to revert to the old version early next week.
Okay, fine, let's leave it then

Having spoken to Morag more - we don't think we actually want the map to return to the French homepage. We want to create a 'Getting to the Games' promo spot.

I'm just chasing up some translation and then will let you know what the promo should feature.
Now the journey time finder has been translated - can we use this as the empty module filler on the FR homepage? Thanks
Any update on when we might be able to implement this?
I am marking this as high priority now. Sorry for the delay in responding.

Hi Fiona,

By 'Getting to the Games' promo spot do you mean the Spectator Journey Planner? or the right on this page here?
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/visiting/getting-to-the-games/plan-your-travel/spectator-journey-planner.php

If so, unfortunately, it's not quite as simple as just moving the HTML for the SJP as all the CSS depends on where it sits on the page / what template it sits on. In other words it's not nicely self contained.

More importantly though, the SJP is not available in French ! 

(some of the labels / text are written out in in JS and so making it multilingual is whole new can of worms, esp. as we didn't develop it)

We could look at putting the map promo there (see attached) but that would still need us to code some new HTML / CSS. But didn't' we just remove a map promo form that slot?

The easiest solution would be to just create a new promo image for that slot that we can hardcode there (torch/festival/tickets?)

Jamie

Hi all, 

could we get an update on this - specifically - there is still a hole in the middle of the page.

Could you make this a promo box - We're going to put a venue promo in there.
To be precise: a normal promo with 220x120 pic on top, and text underneath.

There's a brand new container on the french homepage ready to be used. Any problems with it, please shout!

Thanks
Lars
Genius - thanks!

Hi Lars

I have populated this - but am a bit nervous about publishing it, as in the preview the new promo sits at the top of the blank space and it feels like it should sit further down - perhaps within a box similar to the webcam one?

Please could you take a look and let me know if this is just an issue in the preview, or whether it will also appear as is when published?

Thanks
Hey Fiona, i will have a check!

Hey Fiona, I've added a margin to it, have a look, is this better?

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/fr/index.php

Cheers
Lars

It is now lower, but I’m not seeing a border.

Could we also make the image container the same size as the image to the left – then I’ll update to an image the correct size

Ok that was quite a mission but i've managed it. The box has now a tab and a border. You can also edit the tab title and image.

Is this more like it?

I think we probably need to add a title into the ‘tab’ bit of the box though (“Sites” in this case) or square the box off.

This will do for a Friday evening though – it’s certainly better than the gap!
